channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ‘The Fed went to sleep’ says top economist Mohamed El-Erian, who wants to see the central bank reformed and presidents to ‘cool it’
item.description: Mohamed El-Erian calls for a visionary, less reactive Fed just as Trump settles on his next chair, with Hassett leading and independence fears resurfa...

item.title: The tech world should abandon minimalist design in favor of more ‘expressive’ options says Samsung’s first Chief Design Officer, Mauro Porcini
item.description: He pointed to industries like fashion, automotives and architecture, which offer consumers a range of design options.

item.title: The Election That Has Republicans on Edge, and How One College Student Was Deported
Winter Storm Creating Dangerous Conditions as It Approaches Northeast
item.description: A mix of snow and ice was beginning to fall across the Midwest and Northeast Tuesday, where tens of millions of people face severe weather.

item.title: Tech stocks linked to Bitcoin take a battering as crypto traders brace for Strategy to breach danger threshold
item.description: The leading Bitcoin treasury company's stock market cap is now worth less than the Bitcoin it holds.

item.title: Mandela Barnes Enters Wisconsin Governor Race, Joining Crowded Field of Democrats
item.description: The former lieutenant governor is the best-known candidate in a crowded field, but some state Democrats have cooled on him since he lost a Senate bid ...

item.title: 2026 will be the year of AI monetization, says Wedbush’s Dan Ives
item.description: Most forecasts indicate that both enterprise and overall global AI spending will rise.

item.title: Warren Buffett used to give his family $10,000 each at Christmas—but when he noticed how fast they were spending it, he started buying them shares instead
item.description: Something to consider as the $83 trillion inheritance wave kicks in.

item.description: Early Ukrainian military recruitment ads were a call to arms in an existential fight. Now, they frame joining as cool, a good career move or a point o...

item.title: Floods in Indonesia, Sri Lanka, Thailand and Vietnam Have Killed Over 1,200. Here’s What to Know.
item.description: Unusually destructive storms have killed at least 1,350 people across the region and displaced millions in South and Southeast Asia.

item.title: In Photos and Video: Devastating Floods Swamp South Asia
item.description: Images of the destruction caused by storms that have torn through South and Southeast Asia.
